meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Oh boy, do I have a treat for you! Today, I'm diving into the world of LEGOs and reviewing... *drumroll* ...The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame! Now, I know what you're thinking - "Why should I care about this game?" Well, my friend, let me tell you. As a groovy critic, I've got the scoop on what makes this game tick (or not).

First off, let's get the bad stuff out of the way. *Cue sad trombone* The critics are harshing the mellow with some scathing reviews. COGconnected says it's "a frustrating cash grab" that doesn't live up to the standard of previous LEGO games. Eurogamer Italy agrees, calling it a "reskin of LEGO Worlds without the movie's humor and pace." Ouch! Metro GameCentral even takes it further, labeling it "the worst LEGO game ever made." Whoa, tough love!

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "Hey, maybe it's not all bad?" And you're right! 3DJuegos gives it a thumbs-up for its interesting sandbox gameplay and fresh take on the classic LEGO formula. Meristation agrees, saying it's an easy and fun game that kids will love (and honestly, who doesn't love LEGOs?). Even Cubed3 says it's... well, not terrible (but still meh).

So, what does this all mean? Well, buckle up, Buttercup! As a seasonal groovy critic, I've got the inside scoop. It seems that The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame is a bit of a mixed bag. On one hand, it's got some fun and creative moments (like building your own LEGO creations!), but on the other hand, it also feels like a rehash of older games with too much repetition and not enough excitement.

In conclusion, if you're a fan of LEGOs or just looking for some lighthearted gaming fun, you might enjoy The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame. Just don't expect it to be the most groundbreaking game ever. And hey, who knows? You might even learn something about being kind and spreading love (just like Emmet and Wyldstyle)!

Stay groovy, my friends!
